document.masterDocTitle: Classification, Natural History, and Evolution of the Checkered Beetle GenusPujoliclerusPic (Coleoptera: Cleridae: Peloniinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Classification, Natural History, and Evolution of the Checkered Beetle GenusPujoliclerusPic (Coleoptera: Cleridae: Peloniinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pujoliclerus wappesi Opitz
, new species
( Figs. 27 , 56 , 82 , 99 , 123 )

Diagnosis. The large, seriate elytral punctures present in members of this species will distinguish

them from superficially similar specimens of
P. biordinus
.

Description. Size : Length 6.3 mm ; width 2.0 mm. Form : As in Fig. 99 . Integument : Head mostly reddish-brown, frons black; antenna brown, capitulum with some pale spots; pronotum tricolorous, anterior margin narrowly white, then reddish brown, then black; elytra mostly brown, narrowly yellow around periphery; fore and middle legs mostly dark, hind legs mostly yellow; pterothorax and abdomen brown. Head : Eyes wider than frons (19:12); funicular antennomeres moderately expanded, 6 th antennomere not very large ( Fig. 27 ). Thorax : Pronotum quadrate (47:47), lateral tubercle very prominent ( Fig. 56 ); epipleural fold gradually diminishing to elytral apex; asetiferous punctures prominent throughout elytral disc. Abdomen : Tegminal lobes and phallic apex as in Fig. 82 .
Variation. Size : Length 4.0–7.0 mm; width 1.3-2.3 mm . Some specimens are more melanistic on the pronotum, and not all specimens have the sutural margin yellow.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Specimens were collected during March in Brazil and during October and November in Bolivia at altitudes ranging from
405 to 440 m
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Known from Bolivia and Brazil ( Fig. 123 ).
Etymology. The specific epithet recognizes Jim E. Wappes for his many contributions to the field of entomology.
